page.title: 01INTRODUCTION ONE.
page.content: Blackfield and Langley together form a large settlement in the parish of Fawley. To the west of the parish lies the New Forest,to the south the West Solent,to the east Southampton Water and to the north the parish of Dibden. The parish of Fawley has its own parish council and is one of the richest parishes in England.It is within the New Forest District Council & is administered by Hampshire County Council. Seventy years ago Fawley was predominatly rural with scattered farms and large country estates. Blackfield is a relatively new settlement but Langley is recorded in the Domesday Book as having two tenements held by the king's thegns. The Victoria County History describes the area of Blackfield as a "moor" with mud cottages at first erected.
